noun.description: A strip of rigid material used for supporting and immobilizing a broken bone when it has been set.
examples: she had to wear splints on her legs

noun.description: A long, thin strip of wood used to light a fire.
A bony enlargement on the inside of a horse's leg, on the splint bone.

verb.description: Secure (a broken limb) with a splint or splints.

origin: Middle English (in splint (sense 2 of the noun); also denoting a section of armour): from Middle Dutch, Middle Low German splinte metal plate or pin; related to splinter.
